results.title: A Lesson in loneliness
results.brief_description: When Christian started feeling depressed about his life, he went backpacking around Asia. He recalls his journey through his friendships, self-discovery and loneliness.
results.description: When Christian started feeling depressed about his life, he went backpacking around Asia. He recalls his journey through his friendships, self-discovery and loneliness.

results.title: A Lesson for teacher (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
In 1976 Dr Neville Bennett of Lancaster University published his research report evaluating the success and failure of various systems used in British primary schools. This was the first major attempt to analyse scientifically just how much children learn in establishments ranging from the most progressive, open-plan schools, to the most traditional. The publication of the report was an important educational event, and it will give rise to much questioning about the direction of current trends in British education. The report revealed that in one year pupils taught by formal methods can be as much as five months in advance educationally of those taught by the free style

results.title: A Lesson for teacher
results.creator_credit: John Mansfield and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
In 1976 Dr Neville Bennett of Lancaster University published his research report evaluating the success and failure of various systems used in British primary schools. This was the first major attempt to analyse scientifically just how much children learn in establishments ranging from the most progressive, open-plan schools, to the most traditional. The publication of the report was an important educational event, and it will give rise to much questioning about the direction of current trends in British education. The report revealed that in one year pupils taught by formal methods can be as much as five months in advance educationally of those taught by the free style.

results.title: A Lecture on man
results.creator_credit: Richard Williams and Richard Williams Films
results.brief_description: Using live action clips, still photography and various animation techniques, Richard Williams illustrates a lecture given by Christopher Logue on the human situation. It is a satirical look at humans, their aspirations, and habits. The twin evils of patriotism and nationalism are exposed. (Awards: Mannheim; Annecy)
results.description: Using live action clips, still photography and various animation techniques, Richard Williams illustrates a lecture given by Christopher Logue on the human situation. results.title: A Lecture on anatomy
results.creator_credit: Glauco Pellegrini, Geo Tapparelli and Lux Film
results.brief_description: This Italian art film is an essay on the theory that “the shape of the human body is determined by necessity and regulated by a principle which gives the greatest result for the least effort - the best of engineers could not invent a more perfect and economical structure. Humans could not be different from what they are because they could not be simpler”. Commentary in English.

results.title: A Land lived in
results.creator_credit: Alan Harper, National Trust for Scotland and Campbell Harper Films
results.brief_description: The work of the National Trust for Scotland. By restoring and protecting the properties and estates which have been placed under its care, the Trust helps to preserve the great historical and artistic landmarks of Scotland. The film brings out the historical associations of famous places, with a background of Scottish folk song.

results.title: A Land fit for heroes
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Big country”.
Examines the harsh reality that lay behind the concept of parcelling out plots of land for soldiers returning from both the first and second world wars. Uses archival footage, interviews and old radio broadcasts. Reporter - Ron Iddon. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: A la Decouverte du Monde (Ep.2)
results.brief_description:
This episode is dedicated to the great navigators: Colombus, Vespucci, Magellan, Jacques Cartier. It alos offers an overview of the settlement of the New World by mass migration and through the commerce of slaves. Other topics include: the exploration of the South seas by Cook, Bouguainville and Bligh ; the transfer of gold from the Americas to Spain on Galleons ; pirates.

Credits: Directors, writers, Daniel Costelle, Jean-Marc Leblon ; photography, Jean-Claude Larrieu, Roland Bernard ; technical adviser, Michel Mollat.

results.title: A la Decouverte de la Mer (Ep. 1)
results.brief_description:
This first episode focuses on the passionate relationship between man and the ocean. The sea was first of all an endless source of food for the coastal population. The series than moves on to profile the first bold sea voyagers: polynesian canoes, pharaonic pout sailing up and down the Nile as well as the Greek and roman sailors. Other topics include: Viking ship, the settlement of Greenland, the adoption of the latin (square) sail as well as the invention of the compass.

Credits: Directors, writers, Daniel Costelle, Jean-Marc Leblon ; photography, Jean-Claude Larrieu, Roland Bernard ; technical adviser, Michel Mollat.
Cast: Interviews with Dr. Alain Bombard, Jacques-Yves Cousteau, Jean Campistron.

results.title: A Knight's Tale
results.creator_credit: Brian Helgeland, Todd Black, Tim Van Rellim and Columbia Picture Industries Inc
results.brief_description: This rags-to-riches medieval adventure mixes the anachronistic elements of modern-day music and colloquialism with a 12th century period setting and characters. William Thatcher is a lowly squire who, in a moment of inspired spontaneity, decides to replace his deceased employer as competitor in a jousting competition. Jousting is an activity permitted only to knights of noble birth, but upon winning, William decides to continue his new pursuits. He soon adopts a false identity with the help of his two squire friends, Wat and Roland, and the addicted gambler, Geoffrey Chaucer. William is soon winning one joust after another, working his way to the championships in London. William’s victories inspire the affection of Jocelyn, and the ire of competitor, Count Adehmar, but his ruse is constantly threatened by exposure. Cast includes: Heath Ledger, Rufus Sewell, Shannyn Sossamon, Paul Bettany, Laura Fraser, Mark Addy and Alan Tudyk.
